intro: Symplocos irazuensis, commonly known as the Irazu beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes shrubs and small trees that often thrive in acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by violet-colored berries in the summer. Symplocos irazuensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
